It consists of two main programs: - **Home Child Care Provider Pilot** - **Home Support Worker Pilot** These programs are designed to help Canadian families hire caregivers to provide essential support while offering workers a direct route to permanent residency after meeting certain criteria
 Basic Eligibility Requirements - Must **intend to live and work in Canada** (outside the province of Quebec) as a **home child care provider** or **home support worker**
 Work Experience Requirement - Applicants must demonstrate at least **24 months (2 years) of full-time work experience** in Canada in an eligible occupation within the past 36 months
 - Unpaid volunteer work does not count toward this requirement
 Education Requirement - Must have completed a **minimum of a high school diploma** (secondary education)
 Language Requirement - Must achieve a minimum of **CLB/NCLC Level 5** in all four language abilities: reading, writing, speaking, and listening

Language Requirement - Must achieve a minimum of **CLB/NCLC Level 5** in all four language abilities: reading, writing, speaking, and listening
 Job Offer Criteria - Must have a **genuine and valid job offer** for a **full-time, non-seasonal** position in Canada
 - Relationship documents for accompanying family members (if applicable)
 Ineligibility Conditions Applicants are ineligible if they: - Apply for employment in the province of Quebec
 - Fail to meet education or language test requirements
 - Provide fraudulent documents or job offers
 Legal References - **Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA)**, Sections 11 and 12 — Requirements for admission and permanent residence
 - Caregivers and their families may transition to permanent residence once eligibility requirements are met
 - Applicants outside Canada may apply directly for a combined work permit and PR eligibility assessment

Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must hold a **valid study permit** at the time of application
 Ineligibility Conditions Applicants are **not eligible** for a Co-op or Internship Work Permit if they are: - Enrolled only in **English or French as a Second Language (ESL/FSL)** courses
 - Enrolled in **general interest programs** or **preparatory programs** not linked to a degree, diploma, or certificate requirement
 - The Co-op Work Permit is issued at **no additional cost**, provided eligibility criteria are met
 - Incomplete or missing supporting documents

Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must qualify under at least **one of the three federal economic immigration programs**: • **Federal Skilled Worker Class (FSW)** – for individuals with skilled work experience abroad
 - The applicant must meet the **minimum requirements** for **language ability**, **education**, and **work experience**, specific to the chosen program
 - The applicant must **create an online Express Entry profile** and be accepted into the Express Entry pool by demonstrating eligibility under one of the three programs
 Minimum Program Requirements **1
 - Must hold a **valid job offer** for at least one year or a **certificate of qualification** issued by a Canadian provincial, territorial, or federal authority
 Documentation Requirements - Valid **passport or travel document**
 Admissibility Criteria - The applicant and accompanying family members must be **admissible to Canada**, including medical, criminal, and security checks

Common Reasons for Ineligibility - Failure to meet program-specific requirements
 - Receiving an ITA does not guarantee permanent residence; applicants must submit complete documentation and meet all admissibility requirements

Overview The Humanitarian and Compassionate (H&C) Grounds program allows individuals who would not normally be eligible to become permanent residents of Canada to apply for an exemption from specific requirements of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) based on compelling humanitarian factors
 Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must be **applying for permanent residence in Canada** or for a **permanent resident visa from abroad** on **humanitarian and compassionate grounds**
 - Applicants **already in Canada** may request consideration for an exemption from standard IRPA requirements if they can show that **exceptional circumstances** justify the request
 - The application must clearly explain why the applicant should be granted an exemption from the usual legal and regulatory requirements of immigration selection
Ineligibility Conditions - Individuals **cannot apply** for H&C consideration if: • They currently have a **pending refugee claim** before the Immigration and Refugee Board (IRB)

ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/services/study-canada/work/after-graduation/eligibility
 Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must have **completed a study program** at a **PGWP-eligible Designated Learning Institution (DLI)** in Canada
 Submit the required documents: proof of completion, study permit copy, passport, and recent photos
 Ineligibility Conditions Applicants are **not eligible** if they: - Have previously obtained a Post-Graduation Work Permit
 Required Documentation - **Valid passport** and **current immigration documents** (study permit)
 - **Designated Learning Institution (DLI) details** confirming program eligibility
 - Incomplete or inaccurate documents
 - Work experience gained under a PGWP counts toward **Canadian Experience Class (CEC)** permanent residency eligibility

Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must possess **skills, education, and work experience** that will positively contribute to the **economy of the nominating province or territory**
 - Each province and territory has its own **specific eligibility criteria**, such as occupation lists, work experience thresholds, or language proficiency requirements
 - Processing times are longer than Express Entry, and applicants must meet **provincial eligibility criteria** but do not need to meet federal economic class program standards
 - Must meet the eligibility of at least one of the federal economic programs: • **Federal Skilled Worker Class (FSW)** • **Federal Skilled Trades Class (FST)** • **Canadian Experience Class (CEC)** - After provincial nomination, the applicant receives **600 additional CRS points**, substantially increasing chances of receiving an Invitation to Apply (ITA) for permanent residence

Admissibility Requirements - Applicants and their accompanying family members must be **admissible to Canada** under the **Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA)** and **Regulations (IRPR)**
 Documentation and Application Requirements - **Nomination certificate** from the province or territory
 Common Reasons for Ineligibility - Failure to meet provincial nomination criteria
 - Nominees and their families may apply for **Canadian citizenship** after meeting permanent residence requirements and residency obligations

ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/services/refugees/resettle-refugee/eligibility
 Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must be **referred by a recognized referral organization**, such as the **United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)**, or another **approved referral partner** recognized by Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC)
 Admissibility Requirements - All applicants must be **admissible to Canada**, which includes passing: • **Medical examination** to ensure they do not pose a public health risk
 Ineligibility Conditions - Individuals already recognized as refugees by another country and able to stay there permanently are not eligible for resettlement to Canada
 Evaluation Factors When reviewing eligibility, IRCC and referral organizations assess: - The **severity and credibility of persecution or risk**
 Legal References - **Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), Sections 95–98** – Refugee protection definitions and eligibility

Legal References - **Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), Sections 95–98** – Refugee protection definitions and eligibility
 - Resettled refugees may later apply for **Canadian citizenship** after meeting residency and other eligibility requirements

Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must be **enrolled or accepted at a Designated Learning Institution (DLI)** in Canada
 Financial Requirements Applicants must provide proof of funds, which can include: - Proof of a Canadian bank account in the applicant’s name (if money has been transferred to Canada)
 The **minimum financial requirement** is based on IRCC’s annual cost-of-living estimates for international students and their dependents
 Common Reasons for Ineligibility - Failure to prove sufficient funds for tuition and living costs

ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/services/visit-canada/parent-grandparent-super-visa/eligibility
 Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must be a **parent or grandparent** of a Canadian citizen, permanent resident, or registered Indian
 Medical and Insurance Requirements - The applicant must complete an **immigration medical examination** by a panel physician approved by IRCC
 Financial Support Requirements - The Canadian child or grandchild must demonstrate that they meet the **Minimum Necessary Income (MNI)** based on family size, as defined by **Low Income Cut-Off (LICO)** guidelines
 - Acceptable proof of income includes: • Notice of Assessment (NOA) or T4/T1 tax documents
 Gather necessary documents, including proof of relationship (birth certificates), invitation letter, and medical insurance
 Ineligibility Conditions Applicants may be found ineligible if they: - Do not meet financial or medical insurance requirements

Ineligibility Conditions Applicants may be found ineligible if they: - Do not meet financial or medical insurance requirements
 Legal References - Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), Sections 11 and 39–42 — Requirements for temporary residents and admissibility

ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/services/visit-canada/eligibility
 Basic Eligibility Requirements - Must hold a **valid travel document**, such as a passport
 Gather required documents, including proof of financial support, travel history, and ties to home country
 Ineligibility Conditions Applicants may be deemed ineligible if they: - Have a criminal record or history of immigration violations
 Legal References - **Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA)**, Sections 11, 16, and 20 — Entry requirements for temporary residents
 - **Ministerial Instructions (IRCC)** — Visitor Visa and eTA requirements

ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/services/work-canada/work-permit/eligibility
 Basic Eligibility Requirements - Must meet general eligibility conditions to work in Canada: • Obey Canadian law and have no criminal record (police certificate may be required)
 Eligibility for Applicants Inside Canada Applicants applying for a work permit **from within Canada** must meet at least one of the following criteria: - Hold a **valid study or work permit**
 Eligibility for Applicants Outside Canada Applicants outside Canada may apply for a work permit if they: - Have received a **valid job offer** from a Canadian employer supported by a positive **Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA)** (if required)
 - Meet all **admissibility requirements**, including background checks, medical exams, and financial sufficiency

- Meet all **admissibility requirements**, including background checks, medical exams, and financial sufficiency
 Eligibility for Applicants at a Port of Entry (POE) Applicants may apply directly at a **port of entry (airport or land border)** if they: - Are from a **visa-exempt country**, or - Hold an **Electronic Travel Authorization (eTA)** or other travel authorization permitting entry, and - Possess all required documentation, such as an LMIA approval, job offer letter, and proof of qualifications
 Medical and Security Requirements - Must undergo a **medical examination** if the applicant: • Intends to work in healthcare, childcare, or primary/secondary education
 - Extensions may be possible if the applicant continues to meet program requirements
 Ineligibility Conditions Applicants may be found ineligible if they: - Work for an ineligible employer or prohibited business sector

Ineligibility Conditions Applicants may be found ineligible if they: - Work for an ineligible employer or prohibited business sector
 Legal References - **Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA)**, Sections 11, 20, and 200–205 — Requirements for temporary residents and work authorization
 - **IRCC Program Delivery Instructions** — Work Permit Eligibility and LMIA-Exempt Categories

Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must be a **citizen of a country subject to the airport transit visa requirement** under the Schengen regulations
 - The applicant must possess **valid travel documents** for the final destination country and a **confirmed onward ticket**
 Exemptions from Visa Requirement Applicants are **not required** to obtain an airport transit visa if they: - Hold a **valid visa or residence permit** for a Schengen country, Andorra, Canada, Japan, San Marino, or the United States
 Submit all required documents (passport, flight itinerary, visa for final destination, proof of funds, etc
 Ineligibility Conditions An application may be refused if the applicant: - Does not belong to a nationality requiring an airport transit visa but applies incorrectly
 - Passengers with connecting flights through multiple Schengen countries must verify visa requirements for each airport

Basic Eligibility Requirements - The **applicant must be traveling to Germany for legitimate business purposes**, including: • Attending meetings, trade fairs, or conferences
 Sponsorship and Invitation Requirements - Applicants are often required to provide a **letter of invitation** from the host company or organization in Germany specifying: • Purpose of the visit, • Duration and location of business activities, and • Confirmation of financial responsibility (if applicable)
 Financial and Travel Requirements - The applicant must demonstrate **sufficient financial means** to cover travel, accommodation, and living expenses
 Prepare and submit required documents, including invitation letter, travel itinerary, and financial proof
 Ineligibility Conditions Applicants may be found ineligible if they: - Fail to prove the genuine business purpose of travel
 - Frequent business travelers may apply for a **multiple-entry visa** valid up to 5 years if eligibility criteria are met

It is designed to attract skilled professionals with university degrees or equivalent qualifications to meet Germany’s labor market demands
 Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must have a **valid job offer or employment contract** in Germany for a **highly-qualified position** lasting at least six months
 - The applicant must hold a **recognized university degree** or an equivalent higher-education qualification relevant to the position
 Employment and Qualification Requirements - The employment offer must be **for a qualified position**, typically requiring a degree-level education
 - Applicants in shortage occupations benefit from lower salary requirements
 - Qualifications obtained outside Germany must be either: • Recognized by the **Central Office for Foreign Education (ZAB)**, or • Deemed equivalent to a German university degree under the **Anabin database** system

Financial and Legal Requirements - The applicant must **earn the minimum required annual gross salary** for eligibility
 - The employer must verify that the offered role matches the applicant’s qualifications
 Health and Security Requirements - The applicant must have **valid health insurance** coverage for the entire period of stay
 - The time requirement may be reduced to **21 months** if the holder demonstrates **B1-level German language proficiency**
 Collect required documentation, including proof of salary, qualifications, and health insurance
 - Proof of recognized qualifications (university degree or ZAB recognition)
 - Curriculum vitae (CV) and supporting professional documents
 Ineligibility Conditions Applicants may be ineligible if they: - Do not meet the minimum salary requirement
 - Fail to prove qualification recognition or professional experience

Basic Eligibility Requirements - The **applicant must be a family member** of a: • German citizen, or • Foreign national legally residing in Germany with a valid residence permit or settlement permit
 Language and Integration Requirements - The **spouse or partner** of the sponsor is generally required to demonstrate **basic German language proficiency (A1 level)** before visa issuance
 - Exemptions from this requirement may apply if: • The applicant is unable to learn the language due to health or other justified reasons
 Financial and Accommodation Requirements - The sponsor must have: • A **regular and sufficient income** to cover living expenses, including health insurance, rent, and food
 - Family members of German citizens typically receive **residence permits renewable indefinitely**, with eligibility for permanent settlement over time
 Submit required documents, including proof of relationship, accommodation, and income

Submit required documents, including proof of relationship, accommodation, and income
 Ineligibility Conditions Applicants may be denied a Family Reunion Visa if they: - Cannot prove a legitimate family relationship
 - Do not meet language requirements without valid exemption

It does not authorize employment but provides a legal stay for up to six months while searching for a job matching the applicant’s qualifications
 Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must hold a **university degree** recognized in Germany or equivalent to a German higher education qualification
 - The applicant must meet general entry and security requirements under the **German Residence Act (AufenthG)**
 Educational and Qualification Requirements - The applicant’s foreign degree must be **recognized or equivalent** to a German higher education qualification
 Financial Requirements - Applicants must prove access to **sufficient financial means** to cover living costs during their job-seeking stay
 - If no employment is secured within six months, the applicant must leave Germany but may reapply later if eligibility continues to be met
 Gather all required documents (proof of funds, qualifications, health insurance, accommodation)

Gather all required documents (proof of funds, qualifications, health insurance, accommodation)
 - Proof of academic qualification (degree certificate and recognition proof)
 Ineligibility Conditions Applicants may be found ineligible if they: - Fail to provide recognized proof of academic qualifications
 - Reapplication is possible after leaving Germany, provided eligibility continues to be met

Basic Eligibility Requirements - The **applicant must be enrolled** in an **intensive German language course** consisting of at least **18 hours of instruction per week**
 Financial Requirements - The **applicant must demonstrate sufficient financial means** to support themselves during their stay in Germany, without the need for public assistance
 Ineligibility Conditions Applicants may be found ineligible if they: - Fail to provide valid proof of enrollment in an intensive course

Basic Eligibility Requirements - Applicant must have **legally resided in Germany** for at least **five consecutive years** under a valid residence permit
 Integration and Language Requirements - A **German language certificate (B1 CEFR)** is required as proof of integration
 Financial and Employment Criteria - Applicant must show continuous **employment or self-employment** in Germany
 - Proof of **income stability** through payslips, tax returns, or business documents is required
 - After several years, holders may become eligible for **German citizenship** if other requirements are met
 Attend an interview and verification of documents
 - Proof of adequate housing (rental or ownership documents)
 Ineligibility Conditions An application may be refused if the applicant: - Has not completed the required residence period
 - **Integration Course Ordinance (IntV)** – Language and social integration requirements

- **Integration Course Ordinance (IntV)** – Language and social integration requirements
 - Applicants should ensure all official documents are **translated into German** by certified translators

Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must be **aged 18 years or older** at the time of application
 - The applicant must possess **academic or professional qualifications** directly related to the intended research project
 Financial and Health Requirements - The applicant must **provide proof of sufficient financial means or funding** to cover living expenses during the stay in Germany
 Hosting Agreement and Institutional Requirements - The hosting agreement must specify: • The title and purpose of the research project
 Gather supporting documents (proof of qualifications, funding, health insurance, accommodation)
 - **Proof of academic qualifications** (degree certificates, professional references)
 - Additional supporting documents if requested by the embassy
 Ineligibility Conditions Applicants may be found ineligible if they: - Lack a valid hosting agreement or institutional sponsorship

Ineligibility Conditions Applicants may be found ineligible if they: - Lack a valid hosting agreement or institutional sponsorship
 Notes - The Researcher Visa may provide eligibility for dependent family members to apply for accompanying residence permits

Overview The Skilled Worker Visa (National Visa / Residence Permit) allows qualified non-EU nationals to live and work in Germany in a profession that matches their recognized qualifications
 Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must hold a **recognized foreign vocational qualification** or **university degree** equivalent to a German qualification
 - The applicant must have a **valid job offer or employment contract** in Germany that corresponds to their professional qualifications
 - The applicant must meet all **legal and professional requirements** applicable to the intended occupation (such as licenses or registrations for regulated professions)
 Qualification and Recognition Requirements - The applicant’s educational or professional qualification must be **formally recognized in Germany**
 - Recognition can be verified through the **Anabin database** (for academic degrees) or through the **Recognition Portal (Anerkennung in Deutschland)** for vocational qualifications

- If the qualification is only partially equivalent, the applicant may be eligible for **adaptation or compensation training** to obtain full recognition
 Employment and Salary Requirements - The employment offer must be **directly related to the applicant’s qualification**
 Financial and Health Requirements - The applicant must be financially self-sufficient and able to support themselves and any dependents without relying on public assistance
 Obtain formal **recognition of qualification** (if required)
 Gather all supporting documents (proof of qualifications, recognition, salary, insurance, accommodation)
 - Recognized qualification or degree certificate
 - Proof of qualification recognition (Anabin/ZAB certificate)
 Ineligibility Conditions Applicants may be found ineligible if they: - Fail to prove qualification recognition or equivalence
 - Do not have a valid job offer aligned with their qualification

- Do not have a valid job offer aligned with their qualification
 - **Recognition Act (Anerkennungsgesetz)** – Recognition of foreign qualifications
 - Time spent working as a skilled professional counts toward permanent settlement eligibility

The visa supports family reunification and grants the applicant the right to live together with their spouse in Germany, subject to compliance with residence and integration requirements
 Basic Eligibility Requirements - The **applicant must be legally married** to: • A **German citizen**, or • A **foreign national holding a valid German residence permit or settlement permit**
 Language and Integration Requirements - The **applicant may be required to demonstrate basic German language proficiency (A1 level)** prior to visa issuance
 - Exemptions from this requirement may apply if: • The spouse in Germany is an EU/EEA citizen (excluding Germany)
 Financial and Accommodation Requirements - The **sponsor in Germany** must demonstrate: • **Sufficient income** to cover living costs of both spouses
 • **Adequate housing** that meets local space and safety requirements

• **Adequate housing** that meets local space and safety requirements
 - The residence permit is typically valid for **the same duration as the sponsor’s permit** or, for spouses of German citizens, issued with long-term renewal eligibility
 Submit required documents proving marriage validity, income, and accommodation
 - Proof of sufficient financial means (salary slips, tax documents, employment contract)
 Ineligibility Conditions Applicants may be found ineligible if they: - Cannot provide valid proof of marriage or relationship authenticity
 - Fail to meet language or financial requirements without a justified exemption
 - Submit incomplete or falsified documents

Basic Eligibility Requirements - The **applicant must possess an official admission letter** from a recognized German university or university of applied sciences
 - The applicant must **meet the academic entry requirements** applicable to the chosen program (such as prior qualifications or language prerequisites)
 Financial Requirements - Applicants are generally required to demonstrate access to **at least €11,208 per year (as of 2025)**, typically through a **blocked bank account**, scholarship, or sponsorship letter
 - The financial requirement ensures the applicant can support themselves without recourse to public funds
 Health and Insurance Requirements - The applicant must present proof of **comprehensive health insurance** valid throughout their stay in Germany
 Language and Academic Requirements - **Language proficiency** must be proven according to the study program’s requirements: • German-taught programs: Minimum **B1/B2 level** under the CEFR framework

- Academic qualifications (transcripts, certificates, degree proofs) must be officially recognized as equivalent to German education standards
 Prepare required documents (proof of finances, health insurance, academic credentials, and language proof)
 Submit your visa application along with all required documents
 Ineligibility Conditions Applicants may be denied if they: - Fail to provide proof of university admission or valid financial means
 - Do not meet language or academic requirements

Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must be **aged 18 years or older** at the time of application
 Care and Medical Need Requirements - The applicant must provide **independent medical evidence** confirming that they require long-term personal care for daily living activities (e
 Financial and Accommodation Requirements - The sponsor in the UK must: • Provide **adequate accommodation** without recourse to public funds
 - If the sponsor holds **refugee status or humanitarian protection**, the visa duration matches the sponsor’s period of leave, with eligibility to apply for settlement later
 Submit all supporting documents (medical, financial, accommodation proof)
 - Sponsor’s financial and accommodation documentation (bank statements, tenancy, or property documents)
 Ineligibility Conditions Applicants may be refused if they: - Fail to demonstrate genuine dependency on the UK sponsor
 - Do not meet financial or accommodation requirements

It is obtained through naturalisation, registration, or birth, depending on eligibility and circumstances
 Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must hold **settled status**, such as **Indefinite Leave to Remain (ILR)**, **Settled Status under the EU Settlement Scheme**, or the **right of abode** in the UK
 Language and Knowledge Requirements - The applicant must have passed the **Life in the UK Test**, which assesses knowledge of British culture, history, and laws
 Good Character Requirement - The applicant must be of **good character**, meaning they must: • Have **no serious or recent criminal convictions**, • Have **no history of immigration breaches** or deception in previous applications, • Not be involved in activities contrary to the public good (e
 - Minor or spent convictions are considered individually but can affect eligibility depending on severity and recency
 Upload or submit supporting documents (residence proof, passport, ILR evidence, etc

Upload or submit supporting documents (residence proof, passport, ILR evidence, etc
 Ineligibility Conditions Applications may be refused if the applicant: - Does not meet the residence or physical presence requirements
 - Has failed to disclose relevant information or submitted false documents
 - Applicants are advised to keep original documents and retain proof of residence for future reference

Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must satisfy the **general eligibility conditions** for a UK Standard Visitor
 Financial and Documentation Requirements - The applicant must demonstrate access to **sufficient funds** to cover: • Travel and accommodation costs; and • Living expenses during the stay
 - Supporting documents may include: • Bank statements and financial records
 Submit biometric data (fingerprints and photograph) and supporting documents
 Ineligibility Conditions Applications may be refused if the applicant: - Intends to work, study, or live in the UK for extended periods

uk/child-study-visa/eligibility Country: United Kingdom Visa Type: Child Student Visa 1
 It enables young students to receive quality education in a safe and regulated environment, provided they meet financial, parental consent, and institutional requirements
 Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must be **between 4 and 17 years old** at the time of application
 Financial Requirements - The applicant must demonstrate sufficient funds to cover: • **Tuition fees** for the duration of the study program, and • **Living expenses** (boarding or accommodation) while in the UK
 Language and Academic Requirements - For primary and secondary education, **formal English proficiency testing is not mandatory**, but schools may conduct internal assessments
 Health and Insurance Requirements - The applicant must pay the **Immigration Health Surcharge (IHS)** as part of the visa process

Health and Insurance Requirements - The applicant must pay the **Immigration Health Surcharge (IHS)** as part of the visa process
 Ineligibility Conditions An application may be refused if the applicant: - Fails to demonstrate adequate funding or parental consent

Basic Eligibility Requirements - Both the applicant and the partner must be **aged 18 years or older**
 Relationship and Genuine Intent Requirements - The relationship must be **genuine and subsisting**
 Financial Requirements - The sponsor must meet the **minimum income threshold** of **£18,600 per year**
 - Additional financial requirements apply if dependent children are included
 English Language Requirement - The applicant must prove **English language ability** at **A1 level or higher** of the Common European Framework (CEFR) through: • An approved English language test, OR • A degree taught in English, OR • Citizenship from a majority English-speaking country
 Accommodation Requirements - The couple must have **adequate accommodation** available in the UK that meets public health and overcrowding standards
 Confirm eligibility and gather relationship, financial, and accommodation evidence
 - Financial documents (payslips, bank statements, tax records)

Confirm eligibility and gather relationship, financial, and accommodation evidence
 - Financial documents (payslips, bank statements, tax records)
 Ineligibility Conditions Applicants may be refused if they: - Fail to prove a genuine and subsisting relationship
 - Do not meet the financial or language requirements
 - **Appendix FM-SE** – Specified Evidence Requirements
 - **Home Office Partner and Spouse Policy Guidance** – Relationship verification and maintenance criteria

Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must be **physically present in the UK** at the time of application
 - The applicant must have **successfully completed a UK bachelor’s degree, postgraduate degree, or other eligible qualification** from a recognized institution
 - The qualification must have been obtained from a **licensed Student Sponsor** with a track record of compliance
 Eligible Qualifications Applicants may qualify if they completed one of the following in the UK: - Bachelor’s degree (undergraduate)
 - Other eligible professional or higher education qualifications recognized by the UK Home Office
 • **3 years** for PhD or other doctoral qualification holders
 Financial and Health Requirements - Applicants do **not need to show proof of funds** when applying, provided they meet maintenance requirements under their current visa
 - No additional English language test is required, as eligibility is based on completing a UK qualification taught in English

- No additional English language test is required, as eligibility is based on completing a UK qualification taught in English
 Upload documents proving completion of the course (degree certificate, transcript, or completion letter)
 Ineligibility Conditions The application may be refused if the applicant: - Has not successfully completed an eligible course
 - No job offer or minimum salary requirement
 - Time spent under the Graduate Visa does **not count toward settlement eligibility** directly but contributes to residence history for future applications

Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must apply under the **Skilled Worker route** for an occupation in an **eligible health or social care role**
 - The applicant must meet the **English language proficiency requirement** as defined under the Skilled Worker rules
 Financial and Maintenance Requirements - Applicants must demonstrate the ability to **support themselves financially** upon arrival unless their sponsor certifies maintenance on their behalf
 - Dependents (spouse/partner and children) may accompany the applicant if they meet the financial and eligibility conditions
 - Eligibility to work in the UK for up to **5 years**, with the option to extend or apply for **Indefinite Leave to Remain (ILR)**
 Provide supporting documents including identity proof, CoS reference, and proof of English proficiency
 Ineligibility Conditions An application may be refused if the applicant: - Does not hold an eligible job offer or approved CoS

Ineligibility Conditions An application may be refused if the applicant: - Does not hold an eligible job offer or approved CoS
 - Fails to meet the salary or English language requirement
 - Does not meet suitability or admissibility requirements under the Immigration Rules

Holding ILR is also a key eligibility requirement for applying for British citizenship
 Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must have **lived and worked in the UK legally for at least 5 years** under a qualifying visa category such as: • Skilled Worker or Tier 2 (General) Visa
 - The applicant must **meet the English language requirement** and pass the **“Life in the UK” test**, if aged 18 to 64
 Continuous Residence Requirement - Applicants must not have spent more than **180 days outside the UK** in any 12-month period during the qualifying residence period
 Financial and Employment Criteria - For certain visa categories (e
, Skilled Worker, Partner, or Family Visa routes), applicants must meet **minimum income or financial requirements**
 Confirm eligibility based on visa category and residence history
 Upload supporting documents and pay the required application and biometric fees
 - Any documents proving family relationships (if applying under family routes)

- Any documents proving family relationships (if applying under family routes)
 Ineligibility Conditions Applications may be refused if the applicant: - Has breached UK immigration laws (e
 - Has failed to meet the continuous residence requirement
 - **Appendix FM (Family Route)** – Financial and Relationship Requirements

Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must have a valid **Certificate of Sponsorship (CoS)** from a **UK-licensed sponsor** authorized to employ workers under the International Agreement route
 Financial and Maintenance Requirements - The applicant must show proof of financial means to support themselves for the first month in the UK unless their employer certifies maintenance on the Certificate of Sponsorship
 - Dependents (spouse/partner and children) may accompany the applicant if they meet the financial and eligibility criteria
 Ineligibility Conditions An application may be refused if the applicant: - Fails to obtain a valid Certificate of Sponsorship
 - Does not meet the age or financial requirements

Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must be **at least 18 years old**
 Financial and Accommodation Requirements - The applicant must demonstrate **adequate financial means** to cover living costs for both themselves and the child without public assistance
 Submit supporting documents, including proof of relationship, accommodation, and financial capability
, property documents, tenancy agreement)
 Ineligibility Conditions Applicants may be refused if they: - Fail to prove genuine parental relationship or custody of the child

uk/claim-asylum/eligibility Country: United Kingdom Program Type: Asylum / Refugee Protection 1
 Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must be **physically present in the United Kingdom** at the time of applying for asylum
 - Proof of identity and nationality (birth certificate, travel documents)
 Ineligibility Conditions An asylum claim may be refused if the applicant: - Arrived from or transited through a **“safe third country”** where protection was available
 - Applicants are expected to comply with reporting and residence requirements while their case is pending

Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must be **accepted onto an English language course** at an **approved UK education provider**
 Financial Requirements - The applicant must demonstrate **sufficient funds** to cover: • Tuition fees for the entire duration of the course, and • Living expenses, accommodation, and return travel costs
 Health and Insurance Requirements - Applicants staying for more than 6 months must pay the **Immigration Health Surcharge (IHS)** to access the National Health Service (NHS)
 Provide proof of enrollment, financial documents, and travel details
 Ineligibility Conditions The application may be refused if the applicant: - Does not provide proof of course acceptance at an approved institution
 - Time spent under this visa does **not count toward settlement** or future work visa eligibility

Basic Eligibility Requirements - The applicant must have a **confirmed job offer** from a **Home Office–licensed sponsor** (a UK employer approved to hire foreign workers)
